unittitle.altrender: Brown, K./NYS Library School Register Papers

did.unittitle: Brown, K./NYS Library School Register Papers

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence and documents relating to New York State Library School Register, 1955-1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: File of biographical data on the alumni of the New York State Library School, kept by Karl Brown, editor of the NEW YORK STATE LIBRARY SCHOOL REGISTER, while preparing the 1959 revised edition. There is some correspondence about Brown's biographical sketch of James I. Wyre to whom this edition was dedicated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in one series:
Series I: NYS Library School Register Papers, 1955-1960 .

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.corpname: New York State Library.--School--Alumni and alumnae.
controlaccess.subject: Librarians--New York (State)--Registers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is located off-site. You will need to request this material at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1974 M-74 School of Library Service Library Transfer

custodhist.p: Transferred from the Columbia University School of Library Service, 1974.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Brown, K./NYS Library School Register Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: School of Library Service Library Cataloged 04/12/89 Christina Hilton Fenn

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
